website_summaries.verdict: A premium BenQ projector option for those wanting a good video game rig on a wall screen.
pros: Fast response and refresh rate make the projector good for home theater and gaming setups
Comes with 2 built-in speakers for solo audio or surround sound systems
cons: Projector is prone to bleeding the image over screen edges in tight and cramped spaces

customer_reviews.title: Pray yours isn’t defective. Benq will not honor warrant.
customer_reviews.text: Product was shipped with a defective hdmi slot that does not hold the cord in tightly. I wrote to product support and they had me change the cord assuming that might fix it. Long story short I did all these steps and nothing fixed the issue. The screen goes black once or twice every minute. I wrote back to support to fix the original issue but now it is “out of warranty” so they want to charge me, even though I reached out about the issue a week after receiving the product. It’s a nice projector; but you have to decide if you want to take the risk spending $1,000 on a product the company won’t stand behind.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a fan of BenQ for a while. This is the 4th one I’ve purchased, but this is the first one I’ve bought for personal use. This projector far exceeded my expectations. The short throw is amazing. We have the projector mounted about 8 feet away from the wall and we now have a 155” “TV”. The brightness is great you can see just fine even with the lights on. You actually forget that you’re watching a projected image instead of a TV. We LOVE this projector.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Perfect projector, 100" gaming, great color, sharpness, and brightness!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this in the basement, I've blocked out the windows down there and it's a dark environment. My current setup is as close as I can get to the screen and I'm using a high quality reflective 100" screen mounted on the wall. The picture quality is fantastic, I wasn't expecting a flatscreen OLED display, but dam this thing does really well. Saturation is great, contrast is great, gamma adjustments and other color fine tuning are available. Latency while gaming is amazing, if you've never played games on a 100" screen then prepared to be amazed, especially racing titles! Bang for your buck, I can't imagine it was possible to do better.
customer_reviews.author: Stinky FInger

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with this projector
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this projector. It is capable of a very large picture in even small rooms. Sound is quite good with the two built in speakers, although I would recommend dedicated speakers for large spaces or outdoor movies. Picture quality is excellent with deep blacks and good color accuracy. Overall I am very happy with this projector and would recommend to anyone. Returned an Epson 1040 to get this one and I am very happy with the decision!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great Short Throw Projector
customer_reviews.text: I bought the BenQ TH671ST 1080p Short Throw Projector to use for an outside theater during the Covid-19 pandemic. I also have a home theater which I use a BenQ projector so I have already been impressed by the brand. I am glad I bought this projector! It looks spectacular outside - even with a fair amount of light from the moon and Chicago sky. I like it so much, I will be putting this one in the home theater at the end of the summer. Great projector!
customer_reviews.author: Lawtech

customer_reviews.title: BenQ HT2150ST
customer_reviews.text: The projector picture output is amazing. Short Throw projectors are a bit challenging installing due to its positioning limits. This unit worked out for me due to space limits. BenQ support is very good with helping out if you run into issues with the installation. I did an extensive amount of research on this product and it was well worth it. I have paired the project with a STR-169120 Silver Ticket 120" Diagonal 16:9 4K white screen. I would like to also mention video games look amazing. This purchase is excellent for a basement application for less than $1500.00.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BenQ's Service is Horrible
customer_reviews.text: The projector was great when it worked. The color wheel and light engine both broke after 2 years of limited use. Trying to find someone to fix projectors is a nightmare. Getting parts from BenQ to fix it yourself is just as bad. Everyone I talked to about repairs wants almost $500.00 to fix it. As you can see this is an issue because the unit itself is only $300 more. I would say buy this unit if it wasn't for the terrible response and service of BenQ.
customer_reviews.author: JasonG18

customer_reviews.title: Rivals the BenQ 2150ST, brighter and better image for close view gaming
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a somewhat budget level HD projector for outdoor movies, budget home theater, and a gaming option for short throw/quick setup... this is definitely it. I've compared it side by side with my existing 2150ST, and I've decided to keep the 2150ST, mostly because of some contrast variations, and I think the picture looks better based on some custom settings. HOWEVER.... the 671 is clearly brighter and produces an excellent image. I don't think you can go wrong with either of the BenQ short throw projectors. the 671 is significantly smaller, and definitely something you can take with you as a true gaming projector.
customer_reviews.author: RB11

customer_reviews.title: Picture Quality
customer_reviews.text: My previous projector for over a year was the Optoma GT1080 with over 150k views on YouTube. I retired (sold) that and now onto the BenQ HT2150ST. The BenQ is a 1000% better in every way!! the biggest issue I had with the Optoma was the focus, If you focus the top left image the bottom right image would blur or vice versa, ZERO focus issue with the BenQ. You can get 141" screen from wall to lens at 7' 2" full zoom. It's an amazing projector!
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan of short throw
customer_reviews.text: The picture and everything about it is literally amazing. EXCEPT the fact that it’s short throw. My boyfriend begged for it saying it was better than long throw but he had no idea what he was talking about because now we have an awkward table in the middle of our living room to have the projector on, because you have to have it so close to the screen. So annoying! Beautiful picture though. Are we sure there’s not anything I can do to set the screen size so I can move the projector to the back of the room or is this not an option?! Please someone help.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa

customer_reviews.title: DOA-Dead On Arrival
customer_reviews.text: Don't know what happened, but as soon as I plugged it in, the temperature light, and lamplight was immediately illuminated. Contacted the manufacturer and they told me to re-seat the lamb because sometimes during shipping it becomes dislodged. That didn't work either, and I purchased the device brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas and Ruth Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Best projector for you money.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a filmmaker and gamer. Color accuracy and picture quality is very important to me. But I also wanted something with little to no input delay so I could play Smash on it. It's amazing seeing this 10ft screen play beautiful 60fps with fighting games, and then being able to throw a movie up there, and see great color, and nice dynamic range. Honestly you can't beat it for the price. I highly recommend. Now if they come out with a 4k model, which they probably will soon, it may be worth getting that. The 1080p looks great! But I'm sure 4k would look incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Long

customer_reviews.title: It really does a good job. There is nothing like life size Zelda
customer_reviews.text: We've had this projector for 6 months now. It is short throwing onto a 135" screen from about 10' away. We use it for home theater and gaming with a Nintendo Switch. It really does a good job. There is nothing like life size Zelda!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie D.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome picture at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: This projector works just as advertised. Beautiful picture!! I projected to a 100” screen from about 5’. I wish that it had lense shift but otherwise, it was really easy to set up. I didn’t check out the sound because I had it connected to my surround sound system. I may never go to a movie theater again. We streamed Ready Player One the first night and it was an incredible picture. If I had to do it all over again I’d definitely get this projector.
customer_reviews.author: Scott H.

customer_reviews.title: AUDIO RATING
customer_reviews.text: Big time video for your home viewing. Small time audio options, unless you go out and engineer some Bluetooth add on you will have speakers with aux cords hanging out of this unit. Unbelievable that this quality unit can’t adapt a simple options for sound. This precludes you from hanging from the ceiling because you cannot hang a speaker , electrical cord and auxiliary cord from the ceiling.
customer_reviews.author: chautauqua78

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE Super Bowl 120 inch need I say more. Great bang for your buck

customer_reviews.title: Great picture AND sound

I can’t speak to how it looks with gaming though because i don’t have a gaming system. It was super easy to set up, minus the mounting of course. Also, I was surprised at how great the sound quality is. The remote is a bit clunky and seems to have a lot of buttons that I haven’t touched yet. Overall, definitely would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: As good as any non 4K TV
customer_reviews.text: First impressions of this unit was awesome. I set it up in our enclosed patio space with tons of ambient light. This projector had ZERO problems showing a crisp image. Great for sports and movies. I definitely love the low latency for gaming. FPS and driving games show no impediment. My only concerns with the unit is the amount of heat that it puts out. Not uncommon with projectors but lets me know that eventually i will have to replace the lamp. I highly suggest this BENQ projector
customer_reviews.author: KELEN

customer_reviews.title: Awesome projector. I use it often
customer_reviews.text: Awesome projector. I use it often. And that's saying something because I also have a 65" 4K OLED TV in the man cave. This guy is only 1080p over 100" but I love it. Looks great for blu rays and I do some gaming on it as well. It's my first projector so I can't really compare it to anything, but it's solid and looks fantastic.

customer_reviews.title: picture is great when the screen doesn't flicker

I'm disappointed in the quality. I had just given up on an optima and went with BenQ but this item is surprisingly not as impressive as I had expected based on the other reviews. I like the speaker though.

customer_reviews.title: Image much smaller than GT1080 short throw at same distance

It's definitely brighter and the picture quality looks good, but the image size is about 40% less at the same distance from the screen/wall. Looks like a good quality machine, but returned as it didn't meet my room's requirements for a short throw projector.

customer_reviews.title: Incredible performance at this price

No rainbow visible from the color wheel. I have it on a coffee table approximately seven to eight feet from the wall and get an image about eight feet wide. The colors look great even the ugh I am displaying on the wall - pure white paint in flat. Everyone at home absolutely happy with this purchase. Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: dash-o

customer_reviews.title: BenQs highly rated short throw projector.
customer_reviews.text: Use for permanent mount in home theater. Fantastic picture right out of the box! Short throw, projecting on a 10 foot screen from 7.5 feet away. Extremely quiet. Comes with nice padded case for portability. Lighted remote. Ability to customize in many ways. Made to be used in completely dark room. Highly recommend, and highly rated model by many professional reviewers.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a bargain for the picture quality

I use if for mainly movies and sports and this screen crushes the flat screen televisions not considering the price. Our ceiling in the basement is really low, so anything other than a short-throw projector wouldn't work out too well. This definitely did the trick. Even when projected against against a copper (orange) wall, the picture shows great detail. I eventually purchased a screen which made it that much better. I'd definitely buy this again.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy

The picture quality is bright and crisp and it is lot of fun watching movies and football games. I highly recommend it

It also has decent sound without any extra audio system.

I can understand the merits of 4K but the picture is so good and such a beast, paying under 1K$ for effectively 3 entire tvs bigger than your neighbors “home theater” is more than enough to justify 1080 and about 2K$ in savings over a comparable 4K model
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great Projector for the Money

customer_reviews.title: Do it.

If you have the funds treat yourself my friend. The throw distance is short as can be with great quality. I researched heavily before buying and I run this with my Xbox 1. Friends are amazed and my game stats improved because I can see a blade of grass move from my kitchen.

customer_reviews.text: Great projector - leave the lights on bright. This one replaced a 5 year old Benq 720st. Payment plan was much appreciated. The remote does not work well. Could not get it to control volume. It is also small so easily gets lost in the couch cushions.

customer_reviews.title: just beautiful. Not actually the contrast of a TV screen
customer_reviews.text: So big of image, just beautiful. Not actually the contrast of a TV screen, am projecting it on an eggshell color wall, no screen at all. Just set it on a table, connected power and HDMI and turned it on. one finger focus, so my image is about 10+ feet diagonal. am in sun belt.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good projector

It is distorted and unless it is sitting on a table in front of the screen, it won't square. Other than that, the projector is great.

customer_reviews.title: Seriously Huge Picture from 6 feet.

customer_reviews.author: Shin Chan!

customer_reviews.title: This is the one for gamers and movie minions alike
customer_reviews.text: OOH look what you made me do look what you made me do go out and by a BenQ. This awesome projector is flawless. From the time you open the box you can tell this is a quality machine. I couldn't ask for better.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Projector
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Wow. Wow. This is my first "Home Theater" project and I have to say I'm glad ai chose this projector. The price point is just right. I have the image on my wall measured out to be 196.5 inches from corner to corner. The family loves getting together for epic movie nights. Plus, I have my Xbox One S connected up and there is no noticable lag from the controller whatsoever! Great choice if you're a beginner like me and want the best quality for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Alec F.

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my (already high) expectations.

And I just wanted to add to the positive reviews because the image, ease of set up, quietness of the fan, sharpness and brightness all have exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: The best projector for the price point.
customer_reviews.text: The color and brightness are spot on, for the price point it is hard to beat a BenQ. This is my second projector from them, upgraded from a 720p 2300 lumen (which is still working 5 years later), and I am not disappointed. Great projector, would highly recommend their products.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great backyard cinema projector!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to setup and the picture quality is fantastic. We've used it for backyard movies using a Roku and even some gaming w/PS4. It's a quiet and simple projector and would likely work great inside when the weather turns nasty.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great product, tremendous projection, nice sharp picture performs exactly as advertised. Good price point for a projector of this quality. I would purchase again

customer_reviews.title: Phenominal projector

I have a Samsung sound bar connected for sound. I dont have it loud so its sounds ok. Not one complaint. Thinking on picking up another one as a back up. BUY ONE ASAP. YOU WONT BE SORRY!!!

customer_reviews.title: Am really enjoying this projector!

customer_reviews.author: Classy Mamma

customer_reviews.title: Very nice projector
customer_reviews.text: Great projector! Decided this one over the Optoma GT1080. I use for my garage golf simluator and is bright enough to see nicely in the day time. We also watch movies at night and the picture is incredible. Purchased a few months ago and havent had any issues. Works great with Apple TV and Firestick and is easy to use and set up.
customer_reviews.author: F.E.L.

customer_reviews.title: Great projector, questionable reliability.
customer_reviews.text: Was good while it lasted. Great 1080p short throw projector. Cannot handle alot of ambient light, colors are good for a projector. At about 1500 hours, black vertical bars started appearing on screen, pressing down on top of the projector would make the bars go away. At 2200 hours the sound started going out. Have a service call into BenQ. Hopefully I can get it fixed.

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with purchase

customer_reviews.title: Good but possibly over focused on gaming.

But other than that I have been really happy and youwould be hard pressed to find a better projector for gaming at this price.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money for short throw distance

Now need to go through manufacturer warranty repair process, which will take forever. Would not buy again.
